cip.CSE581.assign4

Class Assignment4

  • java.lang.Object
    • cip.CSE581.assign4.Assignment4
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IRenderScene

    public class Assignment4
extends java.lang.Object
implements IRenderScene
    This is the first part of assignment 4 - Here we add multi-threading to show both how it is added, and to explore the performance implications of multi-threading.

    Usage: 

         RenderWindow -r cip.CSE581.assign4.Assignment4

    As in other assignment 1, 2, and 3 solutions, the code base is small enough that it is in a single file.

    Since:
    fall 2002

    • Method Detail

      • getPixelColor

        static RGBf getPixelColor(Line3f ray,
                          RayIntersection intersection,
                          @NotNull
                          @NotNull IRtLight[] lights,
                          @NotNull
                          @NotNull IRtGeometry[] rtObjects,
                          IRtGeometry lastHit,
                          @NotNull
                          @NotNull RGBf bkg,
                          int nMaxBounce,
                          int nMaxInternal)
        Get the colour for a pixel (really, get the color for a view ray).
        Parameters:
        ray - (line3f, readonly) The ray we want the colour for.
        intersection - (RayIntersection, readonly) The description of the surface - location, orientation, material, etc.
        lights - (IRtLight[], readonly) The light in the scene that may affect the intersection.
        rtObjects - (IRtGeometry[], readonly) The objects in the scene.
        lastHit - (IRtGeometry, nullable, readonly) The geometry (object) that was last hit - i.e. the ray is coming from this geometry. If this is a convex geometry, it should not be tested for intersection - unless the ray is inside, and then this is the only geometry that should be tested.
        bkg - (RGBf, readonly) The background color.
        nMaxBounce - (int) The maximum number of external reflections.
        nMaxInternal - (int) The maximum internal reflections before black is returned.
        Returns:
        (RGBf) Returns the colour seen by this ray.

      • loadScene

        public void loadScene(java.lang.String strSceneDesc)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: IRenderScene
        Load a scene from the specified scene description file. The scene description is an XML file that describes the camera, materials, objects, and lighting for a scene along with specifics about rendering the scene.
        Specified by:
        loadScene in interface IRenderScene
        Parameters:
        strSceneDesc - (String, nullable) The scene description file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - The exception that may be thrown is specific to the loader. If an exception is thrown the caller is expected to try an create a meaningful message for the user, and then to exit.

      • getTitle

        public java.lang.String getTitle()
        Description copied from interface: IRenderScene
        Get the title that should be used for the displayed rendering window. This method will be called after the IRenderScene.loadScene(String) method is called. This allows the title to be part of the loaded scene description.
        Specified by:
        getTitle in interface IRenderScene
        Returns:
        (nullable) The title for the displayed rendering window.

                        @NotNull java.awt.Image image)

        Renders the scene, or a part of the scene, to the an Image.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • renderScene

        public void renderScene(@NotNull
                        @NotNull java.awt.Component component,
                        @NotNull
                        @NotNull java.awt.Graphics gc)
        Description copied from interface: IRenderScene
        Renders the scene, or a part of the scene, to the Graphics context of a window. The component provides the pixel width and height of the drawing surface. The clipBounds of the graphics context describe what part of the component needs to be redrawn. If the component is re-sized, the clipBounds will be the component canvas. If the exposure of the window changes, the clipBounds may only be a small part of the entire component.
        Specified by:
        renderScene in interface IRenderScene
        Parameters:
        component - (Component, not null) The component the scene is being rendered into.
        gc - (Graphics, not null) The Graphics context of the component the scene should be rendered to.

      • dispatchPixel

        boolean dispatchPixel(Assignment4.RenderPixel renderThread)
        Dispatch an un-rendered pixel in the image whenever this method is called.
        Parameters:
        renderThread - (RenderPixel, modified) The pixel rendering thread to be loaded with a new pixel to render.
        Returns:
        true if a new pixel was dispatched, false if all pixels have been dispatch and there are no un-rendered pixels left in the image.

      • setPixel

        void setPixel(int nX,
              int nY,
              java.awt.Color clr)
        Set the color for a pixel in the image.
        Parameters:
        nX - (int) The X location of the pixel in the image.
        nY - (int) The Y location of the pixel in the image.
        clr - (Color, readonly) The color of the pixel.
